data: For a woman who is known HIV positive

General Management of Labour:    
- Routine precautions for blood and body fluid with eye protection, gloves, and gown for delivery  
- Avoid artificial or prolonged rupture of membranes (ROM)    
- Avoid fetal scalp electrodes, scalp sampling, intrauterine pressure catheter and assisted delivery unless benefit exceeds risk    
- Epidural anesthesia is not contraindicated    
- Cesarean section not of benefit for Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission if in active labour or there has been ROM where viral load is undetectable  
- Consider elective cesarean section where viral load greater than 1000 copies per mL or urgent cesarean section if active labour or ROM occurs
Nursing staff to complete documentation form in Prevention of Perinatal-HIV Transmission kit and return to Pharmacy for replacement kit
If/when enrolled in research study, then follow study protocol
If/when enrolled in research study, then send cord gases and collect maternal and cord blood samples for research at delivery
If/when in research study, then send placenta to pathology and flag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission kits containing required medications are located in the Automated Dispensing Cabinet

Order antenatal antiretroviral therapy during active labour. Refer to best possible medication history and medication reconciliation, prenatal records, patient's own medication supply or call Oak Tree Clinic (604-875-2250) for medication list
Refer to Intrapartum Management - HIV-Positive Woman Algorithm
Select Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission Kit,  AND medications according to algorithm
1 kit, IV, once, drug form: kit
Refer to Intravenous zidovudine Preparation and Administration Protocol
2 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: inj
zidovudine continuous infusion (2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
For women who did not receive ANY antiretroviral therapy during pregnancy
If nevirapine is given, select OB HIV Positive Postpartum (Module) to start lamiVUDine-zidovudine (COMBIVIR EQUIV)
200 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
ergonovine contraindicated in patients with HIV on protease inhibitors
If postpartum hemorrhage then avoid use of ergots (ergonovine maleate) unless last resort
Refer to Lab Sample Collection: HIV Intrapartum Orders: Mother and Infants - Known HIV Status Reference Tool
